business.headline: 8th Pay Commission may give a 186% boost to pensions. Find out how The fitment factor plays an important role in calculating the updated pay and benefits and is likely to be in the range between 2.28 and 2.86 for the 8th Pay Commission.

How to achieve minimum credit score for getting personal loan? Details hereThe higher the credit score, the greater are the chances for the approval of your loan requests.

InterGlobe Aviation Q3 results: IndiGo operator's net profit falls by 18%Indigo Q3 results: The net profit for the aviation company dropped by 18% to Rs 2,449 crore when compared to Rs 2,998 crore in the same quarter a year ago.

Cyient share price falls 20% to hit 52-week low. What triggered Friday's crash?Cyient stock price: At around 10:21 am, shares of Cyient were down 17.96% to Rs 1,438 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). In early trade, shares of the IT company fell as much as 20% to hit a 52-week low of Rs 1,402.25.

Explained: Why Dr Reddy's share price cracked 6% in early tradeDr Reddy's Laboratories Stock Price: Dr Reddy's shares tumbled up to 6% in early trade and at 9:46 am, they were trading 4.35% lower at Rs 1,233.25 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw says manufacturing, services, AI to drive growthAt the World Economic Forum, Minister Ashwini Vaishnav outlined India's economic strategy based on four pillars: public investment in infrastructure, focus on manufacturing and innovation, inclusive growth, and simplification of laws.

EPFO simplifies personal profile updation process. Check steps hereEPF members can update their personal details like name, gender, date of birth, nationality and marital status without the need to submit any documents.

entertainment.headline: Stranger Things 5 out in November? Eagle-eyed fans spot release dateStranger Things fans may have discovered the release date for the fifth season through a Netflix code. The show will reportedly be released in November 2025.

Coldplay's Chris Martin enjoys scooter ride in Ahmedabad ahead of concertColdplay's Chris Martin made a memorable entrance in Ahmedabad by arriving on a scooter. The iconic rock band is scheduled to perform at the Narendra Modi Stadium on January 25 and 26.

Newtopia trailer: BLACKPINK's Jisoo to headline hilarious romantic zombie dramaThe much-anticipated trailer for Newtopia is out, featuring BLACKPINK's Jisoo and actor Park Jeong-min. The duo navigates a zombie outbreak in this gripping drama based on Han Sang-woon's novel Influenza.

However, Mithila Palkar and Amol Parashar look pretty together.

BB 18 winner Karan Veer Mehra's ex-wife, actor Nidhi Seth gets marriedTwo years after separating from Karanveer Mehra, actress Nidhi Seth remarried her boyfriend Sandiip Kummar. Recently, she shared pictures from her temple wedding.

When Life Gives You Tangerines: Park Bo-gum, IU's K-drama to premiere on this dateThe much-anticipated K-drama, When Life Gives You Tangerines, starring Park Bo-gum and IU, will premiere on Netflix on March 7. The streaming date was shared alongside the show's first teaser.

Hisaab Barabar review: R Madhavan tries hard to save this middling filmReleased-Fri Jan 24, 2025Hisaab Barabar movie review: R Madhavan's latest, Hisaab Barabar, had the potential to deliver something raw and novel. Instead, the Ashwni Dhir directorial falls into the usual traps of the everyman story. Read our take on the film here.

Paatal Lok 2 ending explained: What's next for Hathi Ram, did he get Rs 2 crore?Paatal Lok 2 continues to captivate audiences with its intricate storyline and profound depiction of Nagaland's socio-political landscape. The series resolves its many mysteries, leaving viewers pondering Inspector Hathi Ram's future. Find out what the season's ending meant and whether there will be a third season of Paatal Lok.

Pics: Rapper Emiway Bantai marries singer-actor SwaalinaRapper Eminem Batai surprised fans as he shared photos from his intimate wedding ceremony with actor and singer Swaalina. The duo worked together in the 2023 music video, Kudi.

Ian Bohen on working with Salman Khan in Marigold, Yellowstone, Teen Wolf, Hollywood dreams Ian Bohen opened up in an exclusive chat about the emotional and dramatic finale season of Yellowstone and credited Teen Wolf for bolstering his self-assurance. He also spoke about Salman Khan, whom he co-starred in Marigold.

general news.headline: 4 Israeli women soldiers, captive for 477 days, released by Hamas Hamas freed four Israeli soldiers to the International Red Cross under a Gaza truce. The soldiers, held for 477 days, were displayed in uniforms in Gaza City before the handover.

Gig workers' welfare board, Yamuna riverfront: BJP's new promises for Delhi pollsUnion Home Minister Amit Shah announced a slew of promises, including creating a gig workers' welfare board, providing life and accidental insurances for them and cleaning the Yamuna within three years if it was voted to power in Delhi.

US Supreme Court clears extradition of 26/11 accused Tahawwur Rana to IndiaThe US Supreme Court has approved the extradition of Tahawwur Rana, a Canadian of Pakistani origin, to India. Rana is accused of involvement in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks targeting multiple locations.

Indian audience's laal ishq: Decoding the rise of gore on big screensIndian cinema is witnessing a surge in stylised gore, captivating audiences despite the lack of family-friendly certifications. Why was ARahane recalled to bat after being given out on-field in Ranji Trophy?Mumbai captain Ajinkya Rahane was recalled to bat after being given out on-field during Day 2 of their Ranji Trophy clash against Jammu & Kashmir. Rahane had reached the dressing room when he was called back to resume his innings.

Noman Ali scripts history, becomes 1st Pakistan spinner to take Test hat-trickPakistan vs West Indies, 2nd Test: Noman Ali took a hat-trick in the first hour of Day 1 of the Test match in Multan. The 38-year-old became the first spinner to achieve the landmark for Pakistan in the longest format of the game.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
